translation.en: before this point?
No.
No.
[Depp] Because you started it.

translation.en: The fact that she's on tape admitting to hitting Johnny Depp,
translation.ko: 녹음에서 조니 뎁을 쳤다고 인정했다는 사실은… "닉 바이얼, 방송인 바이얼 파일스 팟캐스트 진행자"

translation.en: for her to have written this op-ed for The Washington Post

translation.en: and essentially propped herself up as a figurehead in the "Me Too" movement.

translation.en: -Right. -So to speak.
Yeah, it-- it-- I think you-- you just feel really betrayed.
It's so triggering to so many people.
[woman] As a victim and a survivor of domestic violence,
even though it's sexist, you do want to kind of back the female,
but so far, I feel like she was more the aggressor.
translation.ko: 하지만 지금까지로 봐서는 앰버가 더 공격자 같아요

translation.en: [man] Look, they can both be wrong. Amber can be awful.

translation.en: You can totally believe that, but we can't use that
translation.ko: 내 말 믿어도 돼요 "조던 크리텐든, 팟캐스트 진행자 다크 다크 월드 팟캐스트 음성"

translation.en: as a reason for Johnny Depp to be absolved
translation.ko: 하지만 그게 조니 뎁이 용서받을 이유로 쓰여선 안 되죠

translation.en: of the clearly awful things that he has done.

translation.en: [Azcarate] All right. Cross-examination.
Cross-examination. Here we go.
-[Vasquez] Good afternoon, Ms. Heard. -Good afternoon.
Starting out respectful.
Mr. Depp hasn't looked at you once this entire trial, has he?
translation.ko: 이번 재판 내내 뎁 씨는 당신을 한 번도 쳐다보지 않았죠?

translation.en: Ooh! No, he has not.
Not that I've noticed, no.
You know exactly why Mr. Depp won't look back at you, don't you?
translation.ko: 왜 뎁 씨가 쳐다보지 않으려는지 정확히 아시죠?

translation.en: I do.
One of the last times you ever saw Mr. Depp

translation.en: was when you met in San Francisco in July of 2016,
and this is after you had obtained
the domestic violence restraining order against him.
translation.ko: 가정 폭력 금지 명령을 받아내신 이후죠

translation.en: That's correct.
Oh, right into audio.
-[Heard] Please. -[Depp] You won't even--

translation.en: [Vasquez] That's you and Mr. Depp in that recording.
That is.
[Vasquez] And he kept that promise, hasn't he?

translation.en: As far as I know, he cannot look at me.

[Vasquez] He won't look at you, right, Ms. Heard? He can't.

translation.en: [Vasquez] That's your voice on that recording? Yes, it is.
translation.ko: - 녹음 목소리가 본인 것 맞나요? - 네, 맞아요

translation.en: You didn't think he would tell the world he was a victim of domestic violence, did you?

translation.en: I thought it would be crazy for him to do so

translation.en: knowing what I know we lived through.
[Vasquez] What did you say in response when Ms. Heard said,

"Tell them, 'Johnny Depp, I'm a victim too of domestic violence'"?
translation.ko: '나 조니 뎁도 가정 폭력의 피해자다'라고 말하랬을 때요

[Vasquez] Ms. Heard,
Mr. Depp is your victim, isn't he?
No, ma'am.
And once he left you, you continued to abuse him publicly

translation.en: by calling him an abuser, didn't you?
translation.ko: 당신은 공개적으로 뎁 씨를 학대자라 불러 매도하지 않았나요?

translation.en: Uh, he is an abuser,
and you can look either of us up online and figure out who's being abused online.

translation.en: [chanting] Amber turd! Amber turd! Amber turd! Amber turd!
This is a battle of optics. This is not so much about the legal merits

translation.ko: "덜라라 고지언, 콘텐츠 제작자 바이얼 파일스 팟캐스트 게스트"

translation.en: [woman 1] If you just look at public opinion,

I don't buy it for a-- Do you buy this?

Yeah, Amber's fucked.
